The second row gives $1 + a + b$.
The third row gives $c + d + e$.
The first diagonal gives $x + a + e$.
The second diagonal gives $96 + a + c$.
The sum of the first row is $x + 19 + 96 = 115$.
The sum of the first column is $x + 1 + c = 115$.
The sum of the second row is $1 + a + b = 115$.
The sum of the third row is $c + d + e = 115$.
The sum of the first diagonal is $x + a + e = 115$.
The sum of the second diagonal is $96 + a + c = 115$.
From the first row, $x + 19 + 96 = 115$, so $x + 115 = 115$, which gives $x = 0$.
Then the sum of the first row is $0 + 19 + 96 = 115$.
Since the sum of the first row is 115, we have $x + 19 + 96 = 115$.
The second row gives $1 + a + b = 115$.
The third row gives $c + d + e = 115$.
The sum of the first column gives $x + 1 + c = 115$.
The sum of the second column is $19 + a + d = 115$.
The sum of the third column is $96 + b + e = 115$.
$x + 1 + c = 115$.
From $x + 19 + 96 = 115$, $x + 115 = 115$, so $x = 0$.
If $x = 0$, we have $0 + 19 + 96 = 115$.
The sum is $115$.
$0 + 1 + c = 115$. $1 + c = 115$. $c = 114$.
The given entries are $x=0, 1, 19, 96$.
$0+19+96=115$. $1+19+94=114$. $1+a+b=115$. $0+1+114 = 115$.
$19+a+d=115$. $96+b+e=115$.
$x=115-(19+96) = 115-115=0$
Final Answer: $\boxed{0}$
